title: Design History of the Glastonbury Font
content:
Wanted to recommend this article at [http://www.fontcraft.com/fontcraft/?p=1331](http://web.archive.org/web/20131109001444/http:/www.fontcraft.com/fontcraft/?p=1331) which goes into detail on the design process through which the new Glastonbury font was created for the 100th anniversary of St. Albans School in Washington DC.

Dave
author: dave nalle

comments.content: Duh, Dave - I thought when praising your own stuff the word was "advertise" instead of "recommend".

If I were recommending the font itself then I might say "advertise" but what I was promoting here was the article about how the font was made, which I think is an interesting read for people interested in how fonts are developed. Apparently you don't share that interest and probably didn't bother to read the article, so why are you commenting?

Dave
But you wrote the article? That's self-promotion, which is always welcome here, so long as it's acknowledged as such.
